metadata.title: CVE-2020-9850 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A logic issue was addressed with improved restrictions. This issue is fixedin iOS 13.5 and iPadOS 13.5, tvOS 13.4.5, watchOS 6.2.5, Safari 13.1.1,iTunes 12.10.7 for Windows, iCloud for Windows 11.2, iCloud for Windows7.19. A remote attacker may be able to cause arbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-9850` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.28.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkitgtk: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
webkit2gtk package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.28.3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
qtwebkit-source: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
